captions.text: There's a cuckoo in the woods, Mama.

Music by V.Ovchinnikov
Sound Recordist E.Zelentsova

V.Zubkov as Holin
E.Zharikov as Galtsev

S.Krylov as Katasonych
N.Grinko as Gryaznov

V.Malyavina as Masha
I.Tarkovskaya as Ivan's Mother

The lieutenant told me
to bring him to you.
He was in the river, near the bank.

He says he'll only talk
to the commander.
He's very weak, or else pretending.
Stand near the stove. Who are you?

Well? Say something.
Where are you from?
Tell No.51 at HQ that I'm here.

Take off your pants, too.
Don't be bashful.

None of your business.
And don't shout at me.
You just tell HQ I'm here.

Don't you teach me.
You know where you are?

You'll stay here till
you tell me who you are,

I won't report that you're
here to anyone.
I don't have to prove anything.

Tell No.51 at HQ
that Bondarev's here. Now!
A chap named Bondarev is here.
He wants me to notify HQ.

He says he's from the other side
of the river.

If he doesn't notify No.51,
he'll be held responsible.
See? I did what you asked me to.
He told me to lock you up.
I asked you to tell No.51.
You expect me to contact Army HQ?!

- Let me do it.
- Don't you dare!

Who d'you know
at Army HQ?

Tell Col.Gryaznov I'm here.
At once.
Send his report on to me at once.

Bring in two pails
of hot water,
Go on, wash up. I'll be back soon.
in the day-time in a deep well.
It's night-time now for the star.

No. Go to sleep.
I'll wake you up when they do.
Were you here while I was sleeping?
Did I talk in my sleep?

I never used to talk
in my sleep. Now I don't know.

Katasonych is waiting for you
at the hollow tree!

- You mean you swam across?
- Yes.

I couldn't find our boat
in the dark.

Tell the sentry
not to let anyone in.

- Where are you going?
- For kerosene.

Katasonych is waiting
at the hollow tree.

Waited all night for nothing,
eh, Katasonych?
He couldn't get to the hollow tree.
He said I'll be sent to the rear.

The assault is soon.
I can still be useful.

You said reconnaissance
is most important!

That scouts are
the soul of the front.
I won't go! If you force me to,

I'll run away and join
the partisans.

You're going to a military school.
Understand?
Tell him I'll do a good job, Holin.

You tell him, Katasonych.
I can't go.

All right... Military school,
or a children's home--
It's all the same to me.

The stove and chimney
will stand forever.
Where is it? I put it here.
Could you help me find it?
A nazi shot my old woman, too.
Where can it be? I just had it.
And had a lot of hair.

I'll have the house
all ready for her.
Think I'm going to chase after you?

- Watch your tongue!
- You wanted to join partisans, eh.

Get into the car!
You won't run away again!

- Yes, I will.
- I said get into the car!

I'll run away from
that military school,

just like I did from
the children's home.

"I ran away from Granny,
And from Grandad, too--"
O Lord, will this ever end?

Lakhov and Moroz were killed
because they were big.

I can get through anywhere.
Besides, I'm all alone.
You're not my dad to decide.

There'll be no time for that
when the offensive begins.

Greetings! I've been
looking for you.

You must be stricter
with your subordinates.

But you try to do
everything yourself.

There's a lull now,
and we have time.

When the offensive starts,
there'll be the wounded.
Get the medical service in order.
Report back to me in 2 days.

Don't worry.
Everything'll be in order.

- a boyfriend?
- No. I've never had one.

- Are you from the Ukraine?
- Why do you ask?
No, I come from near Moscow.

Peredelkino station,
20 minutes by the train.

Surikov, the artist,
came from there.

and Chukovsky, too,
grey-haired and lanky.
I find it hard to at first.

Walk the trunk. You said
you're not afraid of anything.

- Let me help you.
- I'll manage.
Let's have a look at your troops.

Give me the defence line map,
Galtsev.
I'll be right back. Wait for me.
Some gunners gave me a record.
They said you had a phonograph.

Damn! Couldn't you have
dug a deeper one?
D'you know who's on the other bank?

- Yeah, I know.
- Can't you bring them here?
It'll take an hour or so.

- Have you got any boats?
- No.

- Why lying?
- What do you need them for?

- You're a bad liar.
- They're for the landing party.
That's what I need them for!
No, a picnic with your phonograph.

Oh, nothing. You've a pretty
doctor's assistant.

I'm sending her away.
She can't cope with the job.
I don't need you here... man!

We took the college
entrance exams together.
I'm so glad I met you!
Where'd you go after the exams?

I looked everywhere.
Now I've found you.

I'm not. I was stuck at HQ
all this time.
I did nothing but read for 3 days.

I got you a spring for
the phonograph at HQ.
He can talk like a real German.

I wanted to take him on
as an interpreter last year.
Now he's in command of a battalion.

- Yes. It's an old engraving.
- They're Germans, all the same.
And this one, on the horse,

I saw one just like him
on a motorcycle.

Look, they're killing the people
here, too.

Yes. He's a German doctor,
or writer.

I saw them burning books
on the square.

The soot was in the air
for 7 days thereafter.

This writer lived about
400 years ago.

If they spot us, our gunners
will keep them down.

We'll leave Ivan a passage
in the swamp.
I'll take one of Galtsev's boats.
I can swim this river 5 times.
How can I take you across?

- Then you don't get a boat.
- We'll commandeer it.

Or I'll report you to
the divisional commander,

and you'll bring it here
on your back.
You stay here and rest up.
Would you give it to me?
Don't be greedy. Give it to him.
It was my buddy's. He was killed.
Let me have it till tonight.

So you're not taking
me across, right?
We'll listen to it after supper.
I'll get you a knife just like it.

The nazis killed
his mother and sister.

His dad was a border guard.
He was killed in action.

He's been through more
than you can imagine.

will adopt him
when the war's over.
He's really good at stealing boats.
He'll never take a bad one.
How many boats have you stolen?
He should be sent to the rear.
A war's no place for children.
If we don't take him across,

Didn't you say you wanted
to adopt him?

Watch out, or I'll report you
to the commander.
Keep cool... that's the main thing.
We have to get him alive.

IN AN HOUR FROM NOW
THEY'LL SHOOT US

Surround the building!
Don't let him out!
Damn! It was our best boat!
Damn! It was our best boat!

Don't be afraid.
It'll soon be over.
I hear you were a partisan.

The nazis surrounded us
in the woods.

They sent me out by plane
to a boarding school.

They only go
for stupid cramming there,

"herbivorous in the life of Man"
and so on.

You ought to go
to a military school.
He's not the only one with brains.

You've done your fighting.
Rest up, go back to school.

Whoever's of use doesn't
rest up in wartime.
Right, but war isn't for boys.

Did you see the Trostyanets
death camp?
You're all at one against me.
So what? Nobody can see them.

Let's have supper
before we start out.

Why didn't he stop by
to wish me good luck?
He couldn't. It was an urgent summons.
They know how badly we need him.

A fine friend!
He could've stopped by.
Will it be just the two of us?

Stop grinning.
You know what I mean.

Volunteered, didn't you?
Are you frightened now?
We billeted the new men, Lieutenant.

I wouldn't take you,
but it's an emergency.

Make up your mind.
No complaints afterwards.
If they learn you crossed the river
I know. But still, he could have--

THERE ARE 8 OF US
ALL UNDER 19

IN AN HOUR FROM NOW
THEY'LL SHOOT US. AVENGE US

They brought the boat here
and had a smoke.

The captain was here.
He was over there.

He started climbing out
of the trench.
And then he slid back down.
We didn't even hear a shot.

The captain said to leave
him here till morning.

Don't discuss it.
Get the oars.
Wait here. I'll be right back.

I'll go a part of the way
with you.

No, you're too big.
They'll catch on.

The gully's clayey.
I'll carry you over.

If the offensive starts,
meet us in Fyodorovka.

I, for one,
really do want my ma.
Are you a louse, or just stupid?

See a doctor about your nerves
when the war's over.

A good rain would wash away
his footprints.

Wait here for me.
I'll go for the boat.

When I come back,
call out to me in German.

You said you could swim
this river 5 times.

- Are things quiet on the bank?
- Yes.
It's the first snow of the year.

He might still be hiding.
Waiting.

Who were you talking to
on the road?
But he does! He is strange.

- What is it, Lieutenant?
- I've come to say good-bye.

I'm transferring her
to a hospital.

It's Goebbels,
his wife and daughters.

and ordered
his body to be burned.
He can show you the place.

He saw him yesterday
and talked to him.

He murdered his family
and committed suicide.

Won't this be the last war
on earth?
I must think of preserving peace.
